intro: Microcnemum fastigiatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved moss cushion, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, narrow leaves that are often strongly curved. This moss thrives in shaded, moist environments, typically found on rocky or soil surfaces in temperate regions. Its leaves are usually green to reddish in color and lack distinct midribs. Microcnemum fastigiatum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
